name: 73,000 Years (The Blombos Cave Ocher)
description:
Sealed for 73,000 years in the Blombos Cave in South Africa, a piece of ocher stone was found carved with a strangely purposeful pattern of crossed lines.

Are these palaeolithic crisscrosses the oldest piece of existing human art? Are they the earliest evidence of Homo Sapiens’ capacity for abstract thought or use of symbols?
